cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking WNW through the eastern Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico and approach the west-central Florida coast mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast (around the Tampa Bay–Big Bend region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands, southern Leeward Islands, Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, and eventually the Florida west coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible by late Tuesday night/Wednesday with a 31% cumulative chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 2–4 ft above normal tides possible in and near Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals exceeding 4 inches in feeder bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and very high waves in the approaches to Tampa Bay that could halt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
